column4: I need to burn a .bin/cue file to dvd-r.  I have gnomebaker but this seems to be of no use.  I believe cdrecord is the way to go but the command I'm using cdrecord -dao cuefile=test.cue doesn't work any ideas?
dao seems to be where its going wrong
error: cdrecord: No tracks specified. Need at least one.
it has to be stored as .bin/.cue? can you not make an .iso of a whole dir and burn the .iso once you make it?
i got the file as a bin.
i think you can convert the bin to iso though perhaps?
so?
it has to be stored as .bin/.cue? can you not make an .iso of a whole dir and burn the .iso once you make it?
I just wanna get this image onto a disc asap ;)
I have no dir to make an iso.  I already have the bin file nothing more
making an iso of the folder that contains the bin file wouldn';t work i'm guessing?
you can create a dir? and put all your files there then make an iso of off the dir
i am telling you it works, you can make an iso of a folder

unless I'm missing something.... I have on my computer a folder containing a file called test.bin and test.cue.... are you saying i can create an iso of that folder and burn it and it will create a dvd-r playable in a dvd player?
i don't have the original files that were used to create the bin image. so I can't just *create* an iso of those original files...
i did not say the dvd-r will be playable, all i said was you can create an iso off of  a directory, besides you were not clear of your goal so i gave you advise on assumptions

I think you need to go back and read the original post --> I need to burn a .bin/cue file to dvd-r.  I have gnomebaker but this seems to be of no use.  I believe cdrecord is the way to go but the command I'm using cdrecord -dao cuefile=test.cue doesn't work any ideas? PRETTY CLEAR?!!
btw what is in this .bin and .cue  a windows game?
no. it is not a windows game.  it's a video file (.avi)
cheers anyways ;)
did you mention anything there that your iso has to play in a dvd-r ? you just said you want to burn..
I have NO ISO!!!
well good luck
cheers
